title: Why was the Kargil War fought and what was the result? - Quora

response.answer_text: In 1948 Pakistan occupied a part of Kashmir, then India under the leadership of J. Nehru approached United nations to solve the dispute. United nations called for a cease fire. Hence a temporary border called line of control (LOC) came into exsistance untill a voting could take place under the supervision of UN. In 1999 Pakistani army crossed LOC and occupied part of Indian administered Kashmir up till Kargil. So Indian army fought the war to push back the Pakistani army back to POK across the LOC. In this task Indian army was successful and hence victorious.

The most brief answer The purpose of the war was to push back Pakistan from the occupied region of India (specifically Tiger hills) India launched an operation & found its Pakistani Army, which has intruded till Srinagar so India almost loosing the war so directly approached UN on this.
